image.altText: A young man wearing a baseball cap looks down at his phone

props.synopsis: A man accused of murdering 15-year-old Cassius Turvey, Jack Brearley, will be applying for a separate trial on charges of detaining and assaulting another teenager in the days before the alleged attack on the Perth schoolboy.

title.children: One of Cassius Turvey's accused murderers wants separate trial for second alleged attack

image.altText: A medium shot of a man in a suit and tie standing and speaking into a microphone at a lecturn. He holds up one clenched hand

props.synopsis: Greens leader Adam Bandt has threatened Attorney-General Mark Dreyfus with legal action over remarks he made that Mr Bandt says were defamatory.

title.children: Attorney-General Mark Dreyfus threatened with legal action by Greens leader after Gaza protest comments

image.altText: A courtroom sketch of Greg Lynn

props.synopsis: Greg Lynn is giving evidence in his murder trial in Victoria's Supreme Court. He has pleaded not guilty to murdering campers Russell Hill and Carol Clay in Victoria's High Country in 2020.

title.children: Murder-accused didn't know camper's phone was on as he moved bodies after deaths, court hears

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Focus turns to Mr Lynn's hunting weapons

image.altText: A Chevron off-shore gas platform

props.synopsis: A plan by oil and gas giant Chevron to leave five decommissioned oil platforms off Western Australia's Pilbara coast draws the ire of unions and green groups.

title.children: Abandoned oil platforms to be left off WA coast by energy giant Chevron

image.altText: Farmers standing in shed.

props.synopsis: Wheatbelt farmers like Kristin Lefroy are sitting on a secure water supply despite having endured a bone-dry summer and autumn. They say adopting desalination has been the key.

title.children: Five years ago these farmers' salty wells were useless. Now they are a source of pure water when it is needed most

image.altText: A helicopter unloads SES volunteers onto a clifftop near Lake Argyle.

props.synopsis: State Emergency Services are responding to a rescue in WA's far north, near Lake Argyle near Kununurra.

title.children: Remote rescue underway in far northern Western Australia

image.altText: Women in a rally against domestic violence.

props.synopsis: A string of violent attacks has left nine WA women dead this year, three of them killed in the past fortnight. What is behind WA's alarmingly high rate of gendered violence?

title.children: Nine WA women have been killed in violent acts this year — a rate double that of NSW

image.altText: Isabel Walker Life Chances 2

props.synopsis: A long-term study of the lives of 167 babies can tell us a lot about how family bonds, wealth, education and changes to our social safety net can impact a person's life.

title.children: Destiny's children: The 167 babies researchers say show us the importance of family above finances

image.altText: A centrelink sign with on a building with a reflection

props.synopsis: The corruption watchdog will publish its decision following the referral of individuals by the Robodebt royal commission. Follow live.

title.children: Corruption watchdog to reveal decision in Robodebt referral

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: PM asked about Greens preferences at next election
'All of this is bad': ADF on  sexual misconduct data
Anti-corruption watchdog to make statement this afternoon

image.altText: A large crowd of people, including many waving Israeli flags, outside a large building.

props.synopsis: Violence has erupted at Israel's annual Jerusalem Day march, with some Jewish Israelis attacking Palestinians and journalists, including an ABC News team, while chanting offensive slogans.

title.children: Palestinians and journalists attacked at Israel's Jerusalem Day

image.altText: A man leaning against hemp bales.

props.synopsis: While pushed as a sustainable source for clothing, hemp producers say a complex web of rules and regulations — including going through the office of drug control — make it hard for them to meet demands from the fashion industry.

title.children: Hemp producers say bureaucracy, marijuana stigma, are major hurdles to fibre crop's uptake

image.altText: red, white and blue jet on the tarmac in Broome

props.synopsis: WA Police are calling for information after a green "high-powered" laser light was pointed at a Royal Flying Doctor Service plane landing in Broome.

title.children: 'Incredibly dangerous': Police investigating laser targeting of RFDS aircraft

image.altText: A photo of Daryl, Jacki, John and Ossie all smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Reflecting on how TV has evolved since the demise of the variety genre on Australian screens — and that's not necessarily a bad thing.

title.children: The daggy humour of Hey Hey made cruel jokes permissible in the mainstream. Thankfully TV has evolved

image.altText: Australia batter Marcus Stoinis follows through with a shot, with the ball airborne, heading for six runs

props.synopsis: Marcus Stoinis top scored with 67 from 36 balls before taking three wickets as Australia defeated Oman by 39 runs in Barbados. Follow live.

title.children: Stoinis leads the way with bat and ball as Australia begin World Cup with win

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Marcis Stoinis has been named player of the match

image.altText: Collage of Julie Inman Grant and Elon Musk with a vs slash between them in the style of Street Fighter video game.

props.synopsis: Most of the country has bought cheap tickets to the hotly-anticipated action blockbuster, eSafety v Elon Musk, filmed on location at the Australian Federal Court.

title.children: What, did you think the battle between eSafety and X was over? Sit down. We're not even halfway

image.altText: A group of forensics police officers wearing blue overalls outside a home on a suburban street.

props.synopsis: A scathing report identified more than 170 breaches of the NSW Police Force's own domestic violence procedures, with officers failing to do the basics like seizing guns, taking a statement, or checking CCTV footage.

title.children: 'Inexcusable failure': Damning report on one police force reflects the failures of another

image.altText: A man wearing a suit and tie in front of a podium

props.synopsis: NSW Premier Chris Minns has formally apologised on behalf of the government to people convicted of homosexual acts, 40 years after the state decriminalised gay sex.

title.children: 'You are never wrong': Minns issues formal apology for laws criminalising homosexual acts

image.altText: A woman in a pink top smiles sadly while looking away slightly, in front of photo wall.

props.synopsis: Naomi Bowden's tear-stained face brought a state inquiry into birth trauma to global attention, but she and other women say the inquiry's final report does not go far enough and has left them "heartbroken".

title.children: When Naomi's daughter Bella was stillborn, she was devastated. What happened next compounded her grief

image.altText: A wide shot of a rusting colonial cottage with weeds growing over it on the right hand side.

props.synopsis: When Kirsty and Mark decided to rescue and restore this 170-year-old cottage, they knew there'd be some unexpected challenges. But first they had to reclaim it from the blackberries and weeds "holding it together".

title.children: Saved from blackberries and ruin: See how one couple restored this 170-year-old cottage

image.altText: A composite image showing a shark and an echidna, both swimming in the ocean.

props.synopsis: Nicholas Lubitz witnessed the remarkable emetic incident during a three-year project that saw hundreds of marine creatures tagged off the Queensland coast.

title.children: 'Wasn't quite sitting right': Scientist shocked by sight of shark vomiting up echidna

image.altText: A man in his-vis gear walks past an ASX share price board.

props.synopsis: Australian shares have opened higher after Wall Street's S&P hit a record high overnight, including a leap in the market cap of chipmaker Nvidia. The Bank of Canada's decision to cut rates by 25 basis points for the first time since March 2020 increases hopes for the European Central Bank to follow.

title.children: Australian shares higher, Nvidia joins $3 trillion club

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Japan's Nikkei up on chip-related stocks
New lending higher than expected as investors jump in

image.altText: Michael, Roy and Gia all sit outside in a park, arm in arm.

props.synopsis: Wollongong actor and reality television star Michael Theo has landed his first major production, playing a character inspired by him in a new comedy drama called Austin.

title.children: 'I also don't have a filter': Love on the Spectrum star lands lead role in new comedy show

image.altText: A man holding a bronze medal.

props.synopsis: Fiji Prime Minister Sitiveni Rabuka, aged 75, wins a bronze medal in the shot-put at the Oceania Athletics Championships on Wednesday.

title.children: 'A morale-booster': Fiji's 75-year-old PM wins international athletics medal for shot-put

image.altText: A white and black dog trying to poke its head out of a cat flap

props.synopsis: A cat stuck in a hole, a dog who looks like his owner, and a Tarzan flying cat are among the winners of the 2024 Comedy Pet Photo Awards.

title.children: Hector the dog trying to squeeze through a tiny cat flap wins funniest pet photo of the year

image.altText: a scientist hold up a test tube that says 'bird flu' on it

props.synopsis: A person with the first human case of a subtype of bird flu has died in Mexico City, says the World Health Organization.

title.children: First human case of bird flu strain dies in Mexico, WHO confirms

image.altText: A teenager looks down at a smartphone screen displaying the Snapchat logo, a yellow screen with a white ghost cartoon

props.synopsis: Perth mum Rhiannon shares why she and her husband opted to offer a financial incentive to their three kids to encourage them to stay off social media until they've finished school.

title.children: We offered our kids $5,000 to stay off social media. Here's how it's going

image.altText: A young girl is helped over a fence by her mother

props.synopsis: With outback towns stuck in a cycle of workforce shortages and a dire need for childcare, parents are taking care of each other's children so they can keep their jobs.

title.children: Outback Queensland parents desperate for childcare crisis fix mind each other's kids to keep jobs

image.altText: Hunter Biden, wearing a suit and US flag pin, and Melissa Cohen Biden, wearing sunglasses and a black top.

props.synopsis: Hunter Biden's ex-wife and a former girlfriend testify about finding his crack pipes, and jurors are shown photos of him bare-chested in a bubble bath and told about his visit to a strip club.

title.children: Hunter Biden's exes give evidence as president's son's trial probes his personal life

image.altText: Liam Adams

props.synopsis: Liam Adams earns a spot at the Paris Olympics after initial fears he had missed out due to "universality" rules.

title.children: Top marathon runner earns call-up to Paris Olympics after nervous wait due to controversial rules

image.altText: Front on view of an icebreaker ship.

props.synopsis: Newly released documents show the Australian Antarctic Division issued a stern rebuke to Serco, the private operator of the RSV Nuyina, for failing to comply with strict COVID vaccination rules on a voyage to Antarctica, where an infection could have severe consequences.

title.children: 'Disappointing to see': Antarctic Division frustrated as icebreaker crew fail to get COVID jabs

image.altText: A rocket is launched to space in a big cloud of smoke from a location with palm trees and blue skies

props.synopsis: A pair of NASA test pilots blasted off aboard Boeing's Starliner capsule for the International Space Station, belatedly joining SpaceX as a second taxi service for the US space agency.

title.children: Boeing launches NASA astronauts to space aboard its Starliner capsule after years of delays
